name: Holiday Inn - West Yellowstone

reviews.text: I stayed at this property even though the prices were high. There just aren't much availability out there. This hotel is branded the Holiday Inn, but I have a feeling it was a different hotel some time back. It's just not very Holiday Inn. The layout is weird and the rooms are not exactly great. I didn't like the jacuzzi tub in the room next to the bed. I can't exactly say this is a bad hotel, but I didn't find anything that impressed me, except the restaurant. I forgot what the name of the restaurant was, but the food was great. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful!!
reviews.title: Good because not much choices

reviews.text: The West entrance of Yellowstone NP is just down the street, like 2 minutes away.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised after some reviews on here!

reviews.text: I was nervous about my stay here given some of the reviews but I was very happy when I got here. Yes it is pricey but you would expect that with the location ... So close to Yellowstone (perfect!) Reception service was mixed depending on who was there but the rooms were clean and big.
reviews.title: Unhelpful front desk
Good hotel
reviews.text: Tip: try and stay on top floor as otherwise can be noisy with people walking above.

Have my family of four a king room and wouldn't change it and then charged me for a roll away. Terrible customer service. The room was fine but not worth what we had to pay for it. I would not stay here again. Lots of better hotels in area.
reviews.title: Clean, roomy, no hot water for the morning shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights. I was a little worried what it would be like after reading some of the reviews, but we were using Priority Club Points so we took a chance. We were very pleased with this hotel. All of the staff we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and things looked fairly new. The room was nice and large with king bed, sofa, coffee table, desk & chair. There was a small sink inside the bathroom and a sink with large countertop outside the bathroom. There was a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. It had everything you need. The location was very convenient for walking the town for shopping or dinner. It would be more convenient to stay inside Yellowstone National Park, but if you need more amenities or if the park is all booked up then West Yellowstone is a good choice. It meant driving a long distance to see the eastern part of the park but is certainly doable.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one big negative I could see is the price. We got the room for free with points but if we didn't have the points to use I'm not sure it is worth the money they charge for a room. If I get the chance to go again and don't have points to use I would have to do some price comparison to see if I could get a better deal elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good, but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the Holiday Inn after a few days in the park. It was nice to have a TV, AC, and internet again after roughing it for a few days. The hotel was in great shape, and no real complaints outside of the price. Pretty expensive to stay here, but at the same time - not a whole lot of better options either.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights while visiting Yellowstone. Its location to the park is such that you can get in & out the park quickly. We also stayed one night in the park and wish he hadn’t as this motel was so accommodating with full service. The have a great bar with a good selection of happy our treats. We ate dinner and breakfast there one time each, both were good and the price & selection (Bison tenderloin, parmesan encrusted trout for dinner) were great. The TV is kind of small, but viewable and the room (double queen) was large. They have free Wi-Fi but it seemed slow. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms here are large and clean with very comfy beds. The check in was excellent and we were greeted by very friendly staff wherever we went. There is a good bar and decent restaurant on the property and an indoor pool (which we didn't use). But the best thing about the hotel is the location - very close to the entrance to Yellowstone - just a few blocks. Overall, we had a really good stay.
reviews.title: Average hotel but probably nicest in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything in town within walking distance. Many restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Big, clean rooms

reviews.text: Room was very clean. Nothing to complain.
reviews.title: Still A Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: It's a good location for exploring Yellowstone - doesn't matter where you stay, you have to drive around anyway. West Yellowstone is a good place. Guess we would stay in the same hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We last stayed at the Holiday Inn in West Yellowstone 16 years ago and hoped it would still be suitable in 2012. The hotel definitely passed our test. We were located in a 2 bedroom suite and we really liked the layout as the suite was "L" shaped. The second bedroom was tucked in behind a seldom used stairwell which gave our son a quiet place to watch TV and sleep. The main bedroom had comfortable beds and a nice sofa for watching TV at night. Everything was clean and in good working order. The hotel is convenient to the entrance to Yellowstone National Park as well as some great local attractions: the wolf and grizzly bear habitat, the local history museum, and local gift shops. West Yellowstone is a small town so dining options are limited. We tried visiting a local bakery recommended on Trip Advisor and found it too crowded and a highly recommended Spanish restaurant but it was closed on Sunday when we tried to go there. The Holiday Inn restaurant was okay though nothing special and we ended up one night at KFC. Overall we were very pleased by our hotel choice.
reviews.title: Arrived Yellowstone 3 nights

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in W. Yellowstone Holiday Inn. Staff has excellent knowledge of the area and gave us really good places to visit in the park and restaurants in W.Y. Rooms were spacious and clean but outdated. We were traveling with another family and they said 1st floor was loud but we were on 2nd floor over front entrance and it was fine. Good feature about our older room is to be able to open the window and get some fresh Montana air! Restaurant good and train exhibit a plus! Also had a water machine near gift shop to fill your own bottles for a day in the park.
reviews.title: Decent but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an hour after arriving in the Lake Hotel on Yellowstone Lake and being allotted an expensive ($264) decrepit room shorn of all facilities we beat it to West Yellowstone, a 45 minute drive, to find alternative accommodation for the balance of our 5 night stay in the area and happened on this Holiday Inn. Prospects of a room were not too promising at first as the receptionist told us that they hadn't any rooms for the next four nights. Whilst in their lobby we set about seeking accommodation elsewhere in the town using our iPad and the first place that popped up on Expedia was the Holiday Inn!! Armed with this knowledge we returned to the reception desk and lo and behold they discovered the King Sized bedroom with spa bath that Expedia had identified. That'll be $299 per night, room only, said reception. Expedia says it's $268 per night. Well we can't let at that rate say reception. OK we say, we'll book through Expedia and there and then we did and the reservation came up on the receptionist's screen at Expedia's price. It would have been much easier if Holiday Inn had honoured the principle of their boast to match any price for a room but under their arcane rules we'd have had to first book at reception at their price and then claim the difference back from them with the evidence from Expedia. Ye gods and little fishes, save us from US bureaucracy.
reviews.title: Welcome escape from the Lake Hotel, Yellowstone.

reviews.text: But with all that done it was a fine room; clean, large, fridge, Wi-Fi, good bathroom (save for hand basin situated in bedroom), good linen, comfortable sofa, air-con, decent décor ...... none of which were to be had at the Lake Hotel. No problems with housekeeping and the external laundry service worked a treat.
reviews.title: Nice and clean

reviews.text: What was poor was the in house Branch Restaurant. A Maitre'D who showed no interest, just looked totally bored. A waitress who'd never been taught how to open a wine bottle so just laid the bottle and the corkscrew down in front of us and said we'd have to open it as she didn't know how. So we showed her! And the food, well nothing to right home about. There are some good eats places in W Yellowstone, Serenity and Café Madriz to name but two so give the Branch a miss.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel Near Yellowstone

reviews.text: All in all the Holiday Inn worked well for us and being based there was no disadvantage to being in the centre of the park
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Nice, clean Holiday Inn. It is what you expect from them. The location is great for exploring Yellowstone over a couple of days, and only a few minutes walk from "downtown" West Yellowstone. The price is high for a Holiday Inn, but all hotels around Yellowstone are expensive, so nothing out of the ordinary. We would stay there again. I can recommend it.
reviews.title: poor front office management to address noise issue
Could have done better
reviews.text: Room was clean and roomy for the family suite. Pool was very small for the size of the hotel and can get very crowded. Our major complaint as other reviewers have mentioned is the noise issues if you happen to be on a lower level. We complained many times to the front desk about people above us walking and running all night long, but nothing came out of it. Walls are very thin so if uour looking for a good nights sleep, forget about it. Restaurant was average and very expensive. Better places to stay for the same money.
We spent three nights at this location during a trip to Yellowstone and the hotel was good enough.It is not a specially charming place or anything, is a clean and simple place to stay.
reviews.title: Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, but I experienced the same thing another review pointed out: a constant noise in the room, apparently from the hotel's main ventilation system. The noise was constant.
reviews.title: Better places to stay in West Yellowstone
Very Good Stay
reviews.text: They have a swimming pool and a hot tub. Those were our favorites! After a long day at the Park, it was great to relax at the tub.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel doesn't provide breakfast. They have a restaurant, but I reccomend getting breakfast somewhere else.
reviews.title: Renovated and comfortable; no outside areas.

reviews.text: We will have been here at the Holiday Inn room 146 for over a month. The local ICE Company( the one that brings the 6 to 7 lb bags of ice) that ramed into the back of my car going 45 miles per
reviews.title: Thanks to the ICE Truck that slammed into the back of my new car.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hour, while we were COMPLETLY stopped waiting to turn left with all signals going. Because of the drivers inattention, we are spending over a month at Holiday Inn. The Inn has been wonderful.
reviews.title: Great Spot in West Yellowstone!

reviews.text: Our room is a double queen beds with plenty of room, a refrigerator, tub and shower. The Inn is
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: with in walking distance of just about everything in town. Resturant on site is okay, but has mostly
reviews.title: Clean, Cheap, Great Location!

reviews.text: items for older exotic tastes so if you like more simple food, you will have to look elsewhere. Almost everyone in town is very friendly as well very helpful. If you have to stay here for a month,
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed at here for 3 night while visiting Yellowstone NP as well as fishing the Madison River. Though it was pricey, " the worlds most expensive Holiday Inn", we would stay there again. Property was clean, room as well plus great linens ( sorry, but that is important to us), as well as nice sized.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After driving around WY we were very happy w/ our decision...price just reflects that WY is a very seasonal town....
reviews.title: close to the entrance of Yellowstone NP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in the hotel, allowing us to visit the NP. Of course, summertime and near the park means lots of people, especially since we visited Yellowstone during the week-end. First night, we tried to have dinner in the hotel, but the staff advised us the kitchen was too busy with a group, so it might take some time. In the village, all of the restaurants were very crowded. Second day, we had an excellent dinner in the restaurant of the hotel and the last night we went to a restaurant not far away from the hotel, called the 3 bears.
reviews.title: Convenient location in West Yellowstone

reviews.text: Staff at the hotel (breakfast and dinner) was extremely friendly! We had a breakfast buffet, but some things like toast and yoghourt had to be ordered separately.
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice swimming pool and jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Fun Time!
Good location, good facilities, but noisy
reviews.text: I like this place but we had a room with an added bonus of noise coming from the laundry room and ice machines. It is good for kids as there is a swimming pool. It is really nicely located - but than again - anywhere in West Yellowstone is great. The room was big, had a hot tub, but it was on the ground floor and had a view of the parking lot. Staff is really friendly and honest.

This hotel is located in the center of all you may need in West Yellowstone. I must say I did not have any complaints. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Rooms were a bit dated but it did not ruin our stay. We liked the idea of the restaurant located in the hotel which was convenient after a long day of touring the area. The staff was great as well. We were happy with our choice to stay here.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Room was great, pool and gym were awesome. The service was great. The shops were cool along with the "Train Exhibit". Did not eat at the restraint but it was always crowded so it is safe to say that the food must be good.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel at 1800 and were told that our room wasn't ready. We only had to wait about 15 minutes though, but we were suprised that we would have to wait at all at that time of the day -Priority Club members and all! We were put in a room next to the swimming pool and heard screaming kids for the early part of the evening. This was not what we expected after a long day. The room looked tired and could have done with a bit of paint - it was uninviting. The noise outside the room was unacceptable i.e. children running about - to and from the pool I expect. On the plus side the staff were friendly and the room was clean. Now I have noticed with all the Holiday Inns these days that the guest has one soft pillow and one firm pillow - can anyone tell the difference? This was the case here, not a relaxing stay, either night. Expensive for what it is, my advice is look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: This site does cater to tour groups but is not noisy. If you can't get a room inside Yellowstone Park, they this is the place to go. Not too inconvenient driving back and forth each day you are there plus the food in town is much better than what is available in the park. Several restaurants withing walking distance. Breakfast is only free for the under 12's.
reviews.title: Good location

aka: Holiday Inn - West Yellowstone Hotel West Yellowstone
description: The Holiday Inn West Yellowstone is your premier hotel in West Yellowstone, MT; the most popular and centrally located entrance to Yellowstone National Park and its many attractions. Just three blocks from the Park Gate, the Holiday Inn is your ideal choice for lodging while enjoying Yellowstone or one of the many attractions in West Yellowstone such as the Grizzly and Wolf Discovery Center, Yellowstone Imax Theater, summer melodramas and fun local gift shops. We can also help you plan your adventure with one of our many fun-filled activities such as guided fishing trips, whitewater rafting, lake kayaking, Interpretive park tours and, in winter, snowmobile and snowcoach tours as well as XC ski rentals. Our hotel offers many amenities including spacious, well-appointed guestrooms, indoor pool, a lobby fireplace, free high-speed Internet access, an on-site activities assistance, and unique dining in the Branch Restaurant featuring Open-Range Cuisine. Enjoy one of our regional microbrews in the Branch Bar and try your hand in our Montana Casino. The Oregon Short Line Railroad once brought travelers to Yellowstone in comfort and style. Travel through time in a self-guided, free tour of our 1903 executive rail car built exclusively for Union Pacific Railroad Vice President E. H. Harriman. The car has been fully restored to museum quality, and is part of the West Yellowstone Walking History Tour.
